intro: Ardisia hagenii, commonly known as the Hagen's beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes other shrubs and small trees. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Following flowering, it develops bright purple berries that are attractive to birds. These berries are edible for humans but can be toxic in large quantities.
